name: Northwest Ginger
review: Lifelong search for a long lasting lipcolor is over! I have tried lipsticks, glosses, chapsticks with tint, and other stains to no avail. This baby really does the trick! But there is a knack to using it properly. Some reviews claim this clumps and/or dries your lips. Here's the trick I've learned over time with trial-and-error: I typically apply it during my morning makeup routine, applying it as the base coat to my dry lips (if they're wet/moist or have chapstick/anything on them, it won't last...it must be the base coat). Let the color dry once you're satisfied with the application (the more layers, the darker the color in most cases...1-2 layers is best, I find). Now, do not to rub your lips together while it's drying! It will cause the clumping and irritated/dry-feeling lips! Once dry, I apply a thin coat of lightweight chapstick I'm good to go for the day. And I only need to reapply color once throughout the day, if at all, as long as I keep my lips moisturized with chapstick, which I always keep on hand. The color is amazing and I love how it lasts all day. I have this in Premier Plum and Iconic Iris, which are both very true to the color the the bottle. Love. Hope this helps, ladies! Cheers!

I actually couldn't get why there are bad reviews but I think it maybe coz of a couple of things that you have to know about these (1) they are sort of "buildable"- if you apply it very lightly, they go on almost sheer so definitely don't be afraid to just put on a bit of it :) This is a problem with something super natural however as they'll still look very light (2) After you put it on, let it dry (which it does super quickly)...after that, these just last all day pretty much. Mine last about 8-10 hours with eating, drinking- they don't come off easily.

The color selection is great for work, going out etc. but sometimes I like wackier shades so what I do is apply the closest one as a base, let it dry, then wacky color on top.That way when the wacky color wears off (which it does after eating/drinking) I still needn't care coz these are there!

Highly recommended-but remember: couple of coats and let it dry!

review: I bought two of these: top tomato (050) and brilliant Bordeaux (040). The tomato is much brighter than it appears in the bottle, and the Bordeaux comes off almost as a deep mauve. Not true to color, but beautiful. The application takes some getting used to as it can tend to form a thicker "liner" coat around the edges if you don't wipe off most excess from the applicator. A little goes a long way, and it can get slippery fast. With practice, it's a cinch! Also, be warned that this never fully dries. What I mean is that it remains sticky the entire time you wear it. I've found putting a coat of Chapstick over solves the stickiness. The bad part: the Bordeaux lasts significantly less time than the tomato. I do not know why, but after multiple times wearing it for the same length of time and activity, the Bordeaux became crumbly and rubbed off the insides of my lips long before the tomato. I wore tomato for 9 hours, ate soup, drank from a straw, ate egg rolls, and only had to reapply once (and that was a thin coat just on the inside middle of my bottom lip). The Bordeaux, however, was slightly crumbly/clumpy about 2 hours after wearing it, and pretty much 2/3 off in about 3.5-that's with me drinking from a straw and eating chicken nuggets. I'm not sure why it doesn't last as long as the tomato, but I often find with lipsticks that certain colors just have a different formulation. I haven't tried the other colors, but my sister loves 070 and says it lasts all day. In conclusion, these can be amazing!!! But be aware that some colors might not perform as well. If you are only going to an event for 1-2 hours I don't think you'd have a problem with any of the colors. Everyone raves about the nyx liquid matte lipstick, and this blows it out of the water!!!! It also stayed on longer than the new $22 Anastasia lipstick. It's definitely the right choice if you don't want a drying stain. If you want to spend more, try the NARS lip pencils (cruella is beautiful). Hope this helps!

This is not to say I don't LOVE to dress up and look pretty and girlie, I've just never been one to primp and re-apply make-up throughout the day and carry around a mirror with me (I probably should ;) ... I've always worn mascara, foundation, blush, etc. But I've never been a lipstick girl, because I'm not the type to keep up with it. I do, however, LOVE the look of lipstick. review:
I am going on vacation in a couple of weeks and was really looking for a good long wear lipstick that I didn't have to worry about much while I'm walking around and exploring, and making sure I look decent in the many photo opps.

I picked this up in Premium Pink since the color looked nice and I liked that it a one step application, rather than the normal 2 step for other long wear lipsticks.

The lipstick is really easy to apply, a standard gloss application and the color payoff is nice. There really isnt any smell, maybe slightly sweet if you're smelling the tube, but no scent after you apply.

This lipstick is really really drying though. It settles in lines and is also very sticky.

The first day, i just used the lipstick on its own and it was very uncomfortable, and started flaking off on the edges within an hour.

the second day, i applied chapstick underneath, which helped lesson the stickiness, and kinda of helped the dryness, but still had to reapply chapstick every hour or so. I applied the lipstick around 7am and it started transferring (probably from the chapstick) around 11am and needed reapplication after lunch.

It did last longer than normal lipcolor, but it is really dry and you still need chapstick on top of it. I will probably use it occasionally, but will not repurchase.

name: westiechic
review: I put it on and let it dry.  Then add clear gloss (anything else gets too sticky and clumpy), and it lasts all day!  I can never keep lipstick on, and this one stays put!

name: Doodlebaby
review: Goes on easily and is true to the color.  It stays on all day just as it is advertised.  You can even kiss with it on and it won't come off. Only thing I didn't like about it is that it is very drying.  You need to wear a lip gloss over it.

name: MOM of 4
review: Goes on smooth but then within a few minutes you notice your lips have extremely dry, puckered feeling.  I guess you could put lip gloss over it.

name: Bubbles
review: This was the worst tasting and smelling lip gloss I have ever tried. Horrible product do not ever buy this product!!!

name: BonnieLee
review: Lasts better than lipstick, but very dry and a little sticky.  You will need to keep applying lip balm frequently to keep your lips from drying out.  More convenient for long hours at work.  Not many shades available.

name: Christy
review: Love the color

name: Teachergirl
review: I'm a teacher and can't reapply and it lasts all day for me!

name: Lmbohl
review: I used this product one time and threw it  away. Total waste of money. My lips stuck together and then it dried into a sticky mess. I had to use a makeup remover cloth to get it off.

name: acostalot
review: Comes with an applicator.  Apply once and it lasts all day.

name: Madditalian
review: Awesome color,coverage and staying power. Love love love this product.

name: Ok Kitty
review: Lasts fairly well.

name: Val
review: Just wish they had more color choices

name: Abigail
review: Long lasting

review: I am over 60, it adds enough color without being over stated.

name: Trebella
review: Wish you had more to buy. It was the only one and no one knew if you were getting more in.  That is a con for me.

name: Blair
review: I really did not like this!! I only gave it two stars because I love the color, but it's super sticky and you have to put on several layers if you want the color to be pigmented. Also, if you press your lips together, the color flakes of from one lip to the other so you have patchy and blotchy chunks of color that looks awful! I tried add in lipgloss or lip balm over the color, but it made it worse :(

review: great product that lasts all day

review: have notice no taste or fragrance in product ~ a bit dry so I iuse a gloss

name: PomPomMom
review: I do not notice a fragrance or taste for me that's a big plus ~ I do use a gloss over it or it's dry feeling ~ would like to have more color selection but usually find color that will work for me

name: Lulabelle
review: I use this as a lip stain.

name: Grams
review: I am going to try a lip gloss over the product after it dries(it does dry quickly) to see if that helps with the dryness.

name: Casi
review: I really like the Revlon Colorstay products and this is no different.  I really like this particular lip color as it is a true neutral - not too brown or pink.  Because it's long lasting, it is drying, but it stays on well when lip balm is applied.
